contextId.information: This phrase is a simile. The "Spirit" comes down just like a dove lands on a person. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
This figure of speech is called a simile. Some people will "lift up" Jesus just as Moses "lifted up" the bronze serpent in the wilderness. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
contextId.quote: Just as Moses lifted up the serpent in the wilderness, so must the Son of Man be lifted up
